scenario:
Realty Income, Target, and Philip Morris International have dividend yields above the S&P 500 average. Realty Income has a 5.9% dividend yield, while Target offers a 3.24% forward dividend yield and Philip Morris International has a 4.5% dividend yield. 

Realty Income is a real estate investment trust (REIT) with a 98.7% occupancy rate, leasing properties to high-quality tenants like Walmart and Home Depot. It has paid a dividend for 654 consecutive months and raised it for 109 consecutive quarters. 

Target has paid a dividend since 1967 and has a history of growing earnings and delivering value to shoppers. It has a 47% payout ratio, suggesting it can maintain and grow its dividend for years to come. 

Philip Morris International has outperformed rivals by pivoting to next-generation products like iQOS and Zyn, which now make up nearly 40% of its revenue. The company has reported 17% organic growth in smoke-free products and raised its earnings per share guidance for the year. 

All three companies are considered solid buys for 2025 and beyond, with Realty Income being a "forever stock," Target offering a good buying opportunity due to its history of paying dividends, and Philip Morris International being a "smoking hot" dividend stock.
